course_title: Freshmen Seminar in MESAS: Mysticism in the Middle East

class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
(This course will introduce students to the practice of mysticism among Jews, Christians, and Muslims in the Middle East in late antiquity and the medieval period (200 CE to 1500 CE).  Shared themes and practices of Jewish, Christian, and Islamic mystical traditions will be a major focus of the course.  After exploring the important question, "What is mysticism?" students will be introduced to Jewish Heikhalot (divine palaces) and Markabah (divine chariot) mysticism, early eastern Christian mysticism, Platonist philosophical mysticism, and the Islamic tradition of Sufism. Topics to be explored include: the difference between a saint and a sage; angels, devils, and heavenly powers; mysticism as a spiritual path; women mystics of the Middle East; and the role of secrecy and occult knowledge.)
course_description: Exclusively for first-year students. Seminar provides introduction to various historical, religious, cultural, and linguistic aspects of the Middle East and South Asia. Topics vary.
